summary:
Excerpt(s) below are from Quora’s Rebecca Matthies who neither ships J/D or J/S. 
“Because sticking your two obvious romantic...
body:
This Non-Shipper Gets It! 👍

Excerpt(s) below are from Quora’s Rebecca Matthies who neither ships J/D or J/S.

“Because sticking your two obvious romantic leads on the cover of a magazine with the words “End Game” written on it and then loudly proclaim that the ending will be a shock (“you won’t see it coming”, “brave” were amongst the words used to describe it) has doom written all over it.”

“Now, either Jon and Daenerys are endgame and the writers and producers have lost their minds…or this series won’t end up with everyone’s favourite incestious couple riding into the sunset on their dragon(s)”

Gotta love Quora for their honest analysis and intelligent insightful A2As. 😊

*Edited to add link

https://www.quora.com/The-first-footage-and-then-the-first-image-from-season-8-of-Game-of-Thrones-show-Jon-with-Sansa-and-Dany-respectively-Are-we-headed-for-a-love-triangle-in-the-final-season/answer/Rebecca-Matthies?ch=10&share=cb199ad0&srid=hzh2l

summary: Which seven Game of Thrones characters should Jon Snow name to his Kingsguard?
title: Which seven Game of Thrones characters should Jon Snow name to his Kingsguard?
excerpt: "The Kingsguard is a sworn brotherhood. Our vows are taken for life. Only death relieves us of our sacred trust." ~Barristan Selmy, Lord Commande...
description: Who’s in your Seven? My bf said to include Bronn, and I’m like dude, he’s a great fighter sure, but you can’t trust him as far as you can throw him. What say y’all?

tags: 8η σεζόν του Game Of Thrones θα αργήσει
summary: Το Battle of the Bastards μοιάζει λούνα παρκ μπροστά στο τέλος του Game Of Thrones
title: Το Battle of the Bastards μοιάζει λούνα παρκ μπροστά στο τέλος του Game Of Thrones
body:
Το EW σε ένα εκτενές αφιέρωμα, ανοίγει τον «φάκελο» της 8ης σεζόν του Game Of Thrones, σε μια πορεία, από το περσινό διάβασμα του σεναρίου μέχρι τα γυρίσματα των επικών μαχών, που σύμφωνα με τα λεγόμενα του Peter Dinklage, το Battle of the Bastards μοιάζει λούνα παρκ μπροστά τους.

Το φινάλε της 7ης σεζόν του Game of Thrones βρίσκεις τον Night King στο Τείχος του Westeros με τον Ice Dragon του, ενώ εκατοντάδες χιλιάδες Wights τον ακολουθούν νότια του τείχους, δηλαδή προς το κάστρο του Winterfell.

Το GoT είναι αυτό που τράβηξε τα όρια μεταξύ τηλεόρασης και κινηματογράφου, όσον αφορά τα γυρίσματα και τα εφέ, ενώ ήδη είχε γίνει γνωστό πως τα γυρίσματα μιας μάχης διήρκεσαν περίπου δυο μήνες αλλά τώρα γίνονται γνωστές νέες ζουμερές πληροφορίες για αυτή την περιβόητη μάχη.

Χαρακτηριστικά το άρθρο του EW αναφέρει:

Αυτές οι 55 νύχτες ήταν μόνο για τις εξωτερικές σκηνές της μάχης στο πλατό του Winterfell. Τα γυρίσματα μετακόμισαν έπειτα στο στούντιο, όπου ο Sapochnik συνέχισε να γυρίζει την ίδια μάχη για βδομάδες μετά από αυτό!

Ακόμη ένα ενδιαφέρον γεγονός, όπως αποκάλυψε ο showrunner, David Benioff, είναι πώς σε αυτή τη μάχη θα υπάρχουν πολλά storylines που θα εξελίσσονται:

Το να έχεις τη μεγαλύτερη μάχη δεν ακούγεται και τόσο ενθουσιώδες -πραγματικά ακούγεται βαρετό. Μέρος της πρόκλησης και στην πραγματικότητα ήταν του Miguel (Sapochnik, σκηνοθέτη του επεισοδίου) πρόκληση το πώς να την κρατήσει ελκυστική.  Χτίζουμε προς αυτή την εξέλιξη από την αρχή του σόου, είναι οι ζωντανοί εναντίον των νεκρών και δεν μπορείς να το βγάλεις σε μια σεκάνς των 12 λεπτών.

Χωρίς καν να ξέρουμε πόσο θα διαρκέσει, ίσως και ολόκληρο το 6ο και τελευταίο επεισόδιο να είναι αυτή η τελική γιγαντιαία μάχη, όλα αυτά ακούγονται συναρπαστικά για το τι έχει ετοιμάσει η παραγωγή του HBO.

Το Game of Thrones Season 8 θα κάνει πρεμιέρα κάποια στιγμή μέσα στο πρώτο μισό του 2019.

blog.name: marta-elentari
blog.title: Varda Elentarí
blog.description: Marta | She/Her | 21 | Med student | 🇷🇴 | Orthodox Christian | Hetero-demisexual, but gay for Varda Elentari | Ask box open I Major Tolkien fan, meaning that I post/reblog anything L0TR and Silmarillion related | Love AS0IAF too (but totally anti Game of Clowns) | Melkor & Varda specialist | In this house, we also stan Tywin Lannister (and our lord and saviour Charles Dance), Joanna Lannister and Daenerys Targaryen | Therefore I am 50% Lann 50% Targ | If you like Sansa Stark, this is not the place for you | Melkor & Varda and Tywin & Joanna are my OTPs | I paint and I write metas | I love making edits as well | Shitposting will go ever on and on on this page | I also post/discuss/reblog things about other fantasy series I like, such as Harry Potter, Witcher, Wheel of Time and Kingkiller Chronicle | Sideblog: @star-crossedvoyager (mostly for anti sjm posts) | You can find me on insta: @martaaaisabella (my personal account); @martaaa1506 (for Tolkien stuff and anti SJM shitposts)

summary: This girl came up to me in a bar and she said, "My God, MY GOD, you look like Jon Snow." And I said, "Well, I am." And she was...
body:
This girl came up to me in a bar and she said, “My God, MY GOD, you look like Jon Snow.” And I said, “Well, I am.” And she was like, “Nah, he’s much taller than you.”

-Kit Harington

reblog.comment:
This girl came up to me in a bar and she said, “My God, MY GOD, you look like Jon Snow.” And I said, “Well, I am.” And she was like, “Nah, he’s much taller than you.”

-Kit Harington

trail.content_raw:
This girl came up to me in a bar and she said, “My God, MY GOD, you look like Jon Snow.” And I said, “Well, I am.” And she was like, “Nah, he’s much taller than you.”

-Kit Harington
trail.content:
This girl came up to me in a bar and she said, “My God, MY GOD, you look like Jon Snow.” And I said, “Well, I am.” And she was like, “Nah, he’s much taller than you.”

-Kit Harington

blog.name: jonsa101
blog.title: Jonsa101
blog.description: #Jonsa and #Sharpwin Meta Writer. Pop Culture Obsessed. Lover of Street Style.

summary: You know what kills me about this scene? Sansa took that cup of ale and drank it KNOWING DAMN WELL she doesn’t like ale and...
body:
You know what kills me about this scene? Sansa took that cup of ale and drank it KNOWING DAMN WELL she doesn’t like ale and doesn’t even like to drink!

SANSA, GIRL

Granted this whole interaction was propbably weird AF, since they never had a relationship in the past and don’t know how to interact as brother and sister. Also it doesn’t help that they’re both grown and extremely attractive. Either way, girls doing shit they don’t normally/willingly do to impress guys is the definition of flirting. It’s practically flirting 101 and honestly I have always felt that Jon and Sansa were inadvertently flirting here. There whole interaction throughout this scene is very flirtatious in nature. The stares, the small jokes, the blushing, the playful way Sansa asks for forgiveness. It’s all there.

SANSA, GIRL

summary: I wonder when Kit is completely done with filming GOT and the new season has aired or will air soon. Will he just show up in...
body:
I wonder when Kit is completely done with filming GOT and the new season has aired or will air soon. Will he just show up in some picture somewhere with shorter hair and without the beard? Or will he post a video out there of his hair getting cut and shaved?

I mean his hair is a big part of the show and character, so I can see him going with something else when he finally leaves Westeros behind.

reblog.comment:

I mean his hair is a big part of the show and character, so I can see him going with something else when he finally leaves Westeros behind.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: While I do agree that D&D really don’t know how to do well written strong female characters on the show - or any character for...
body:
While I do agree that D&D really don’t know how to do well written strong female characters on the show - or any character for that matter considering how Jon has been stripped of his complexities on the show, I disagree with the idea that it’s just been the male characters that have been white washed on the show. The female characters on the show have been liberally white-washed as well in their transition from books to show. Consider:

Sansa Stark: Her defining act in book one is the betrayal of her family to Cersei. her tattling to Cersei all of Ned’s plans leads to Arya, Jeyne and Sansa herself not being on a ship to WF as Ned intended. Instead Jeyne gets stuck with LF, Arya has to go on the run and Sansa herself is stuck in KL. Ned confesses to save Sansa’s life and ends up losing his head. GRRM has said that Sansa is partially responsible for Ned’s death. And yet on the show, Sansa does not tattle to Cersei, the show blames Ned for everything that happened in KL with Sansa calling him stupid and Arya has no real issues with Sansa and has to fight with her over a letter. Even in the Vale, Sansa has no issues giving SweetRobin dangerously high levels of SweetSleep because LF knows best. Even on the show D&D never fully commit to Sansa’s arc of choosing between power and family, often framing scenes as Jon and Arya being in the wrong while Sansa is right to go against them. D&D have admitted that they don’t like it when Sansa gets hate from an audience and Bryan Cogman’s hyper-defensiveness of the character is an indication of why the writing for Sansa is so bad on the show.

Catelyn Stark: Catelyn in the books really dislikes Jon Snow. And that’s fine, that’s a flaw in this very well written unique strong female character in the books. But the one thing that really made book readers dislike her was this bit:

“It should have been you”

Catelyn wishing that it was Jon who was dying instead of Bran. Cruel and vicious. Catelyn calling Jon by his name for the first time - only to tell him that she wished he was the one dying. Jon feeling scared and nervous about entering the room when Cat was there. Jon hiding his sadness from Robb etc. Cat embraced her dislike of Jon and while she sometimes felt slightly guilty about it (Like when she met Mya), she never shied away from it. The show on the other hand, removed this whole part and added a whole scene about Cat feeling sad because she could not love Jon as a son.

Cersei Lannister: Cersei of one of those rare characters who is actually much well written on the show compared to the books. She’s not one dimensionally evil like the book version and Lena Headey adds weight to the character with her wonderful acting. While GRRM throws Cersei’s character under the bus for Jaime’s redemption arc, the show does the opposite and develops Cersei at Jaime’s expense. In the books, it’s Cersei who kills all of Robert’s bastard babies. On the show it’s Joffrey.

Daenerys Targaryen: With respect to Arya and Dany, D&D’s take on them reduces them to merciless, bad-ass killers stripping them of their complexities, guilt, remorse, self-doubt, and regret which in the books makes us understand why these characters do the things they do. While the show has added in some shitty scenes (Dany roasting the slavers), they have also removed some parts that are often used to critique Dany’s rule in slaver’s bay. These include:

- her impulsive decision to have the wineseller’s daughters interrogated by the shavepate when her beloved unsullied are ambushed and murdered. Dany does regret this later, but this is one of her unpopular actions.

- the collective punishment she hands out in which innocent people including children may have died.

- I also like that on the show Dany executes Mossador for murder while in the books, she hesitates to punish her men for the crimes they commit against the former slavers.

Arya Stark: Arya is such a beautifully written character in the books - a fun loving child who becomes a traumatized child soldier after her harrowing trip through Westeros and ending up in Braavos. D&D reading her as just a bad-ass ninja going from one fun adventure to another clearly shows in how they write her as a revenge obsessed psychopath who is only good at killing.

In the books, Arya does end up killing the insurance man. She mulls over it for an entire chapter trying to convince herself that this was the right thing to do - but she feels guilt and feels like she has no other choice. But she does do it. On the show, Arya is sidetracked by Meryn Trant and kills him instead. And then the FM gives her Lady Crane and she decides to not do it and leaves the FM.

So, I would say that all the characters on the show have been whitewashed and not just the male characters. Some of Jon’s morally complex decisions have been removed on the show - but that’s not surprising considering his entire arc in ADwD was removed in favor of highlighting how Sansa is now a political mastermind and bad-ass who takes down Ramsay.

In my opinion, Tyrion is the most white-washed character on the show. That’s why I find it rather hilarious when he criticizes Dany - this is the guy who burned people to death using wildfire, the guy who rapes a slave out of bitterness - he is now the moral beacon of the show? GRRM is probably laughing right now at that thought!!

So, I would say that all the characters on the show have been whitewashed and not just the male characters. blog.name: wightjon
blog.title: liam cunningham is still a jonsa
blog.description: elizabeth. Sophie Turner thinks I'm amazing

summary:
Jon x Sansa: Coffee Shop AU
You get ready, you get all dressed up
To go nowhere in particular
Back to work or the coffee...
body:
Jon x Sansa: Coffee Shop AU

You get ready, you get all dressed up

To go nowhere in particular

Back to work or the coffee shop

Doesn’t matter ‘cause it’s enough

To be young and in love

To be young and in love
